titleStmt.title: John W. Applegate to Ephraim L. Van Winkle
CWG1711

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Cincinnati Oct. 7,/63,
To The Secretary of State,
At Frankfort Ky,
Dear Sir:

I have to acknowledge your favor of the 3d inst, advising me of the expiration of my commission, for your State in this, on the 5th inst. Having served the Commonwealth so long in that capacity it is gratifying that I am deemed still worthy that honor and therefore I apply for another Commission, although it has long since ceased to be a source of any pecuniary profit.
Inclosed please find five dollars the statuary fee for said Commission.

Ohio
Comr Deeds
J. W. Applegate
Comd
8th Oct/63
